open-rules.name: Emerging Threats Open Ruleset
open-rules.desc: Proofpoint ET Open is a timely and accurate rule set for detecting and blocking advanced threats

pro-ruleset.name: Emerging Threats Pro Ruleset
pro-ruleset.desc: Proofpoint ET Pro is a timely and accurate rule set for detecting and blocking advanced threats

attack-detection.name: Positive Technologies Attack Detection Team ruleset
attack-detection.desc: The Attack Detection Team searches for new vulnerabilities and 0-days, reproduces it and creates PoC exploits to understand how these security flaws work and how related attacks can be detected on the network layer. Additionally, we are interested in malware and hackersâ€™ TTPs, so we develop Suricata rules for detecting all sorts of such activities.

suricata-latest.name: Secureworks suricata-enhanced ruleset
suricata-latest.desc: Broad ruleset composed of malware rules and other security-related countermeasures, and curated by the Secureworks Counter Threat Unit research team.  This ruleset has been enhanced with comprehensive and fully standard-compliant BETTER metadata (https://better-schema.readthedocs.io/).

suricata-malware.name: Secureworks suricata-malware ruleset
suricata-malware.desc: High-fidelity, high-priority ruleset composed mainly of malware-related countermeasures and curated by the Secureworks Counter Threat Unit research team.

threat-intelligence.name: Secureworks suricata-security ruleset
threat-intelligence.desc: Broad ruleset composed of malware rules and other security-related countermeasures, and curated by the Secureworks Counter Threat Unit research team.

sslblacklist.name: Abuse.ch SSL Blacklist
sslblacklist.desc: The SSL Blacklist (SSLBL) is a project of abuse.ch with the goal of detecting malicious SSL connections, by identifying and blacklisting SSL certificates used by botnet C&C servers. In addition, SSLBL identifies JA3 fingerprints that helps you to detect & block malware botnet C&C communication on the TCP layer.

ja3-fingerprint.name: Abuse.ch Suricata JA3 Fingerprint Ruleset
ja3-fingerprint.desc: If you are running Suricata, you can use the SSLBLs Suricata JA3 FingerprintRuleset to detect and/or block malicious SSL connections in your network based on the JA3 fingerprint. Please note that your need Suricata 4.1.0 or newer in order to use the JA3 fingerprint ruleset.

threat-hunting.name: Threat hunting rules
threat-hunting.desc: Heuristic ruleset for hunting. Focus on anomaly detection and showcasing latest engine features, not performance.
